sentence.Network_en: Due to his nonfeasance toward work, he was fired by his employer.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于工作懈怠, 他已经被公司褫革.

sentence.Network_en: The main body with national jural nonfeasance joins suit.
sentence.Network_cn: 国家不作为法律上的主体参加诉讼.

sentence.Network_en: Nonfeasance WTO member, also should go according to general international convention thing.
sentence.Network_cn: 不作为世贸组织成员, 也要按照一般国际惯例行事.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from non- + feasance (see malfeasance)

means.word_mean: 1. a failure to act when under an obligation to do so; a refusal (without sufficient excuse) to do that which it is your legal duty to do

auth_sentence.content: This failure to act in the way that we entrust you to do, or nonfeasance, is now borderline malfeasance, or actual misconduct.
